Common Issues Faced While Using Payoneer Users may encounter various issues while using Payoneer. Some common problems are as follows: 1. Account Verification Issues Delay in document verification Rejection of ID card or bank statement Account suspension or blockage 2. Payment Issues Delay in bank transfers Funds not received Difficulty in receiving payments from specific countries Issues with making payments using the Payoneer card 3. Fees and Charges High transaction fees Annual

Payoneer exploits freelancers with excessive fees, including a **$29.95 annual charge**, **$3 per Fiverr withdrawal**, and a **3% currency conversion fee**, significantly reducing earnings. Their **lack of transparency** and **poor customer support** make matters worse. With better alternatives like Wise and Revolut, Payoneer feels like a **"freelancer tax machine."** Avoid if possible, as their unfair fees make them one of the worst payment platforms for independent professionals.

Payoneer is not in compliance with the law. They are not regulated by the Central Bank of the Philippines as an e-money issuer. It's mandatory to accept ePhilID as the same as the Philippine National ID card. This ID is provided alternatively while waiting for the card to be delivered, which may take more than a year as millions are registered. I recommend PayPal instead, which is regulated by the Central Bank of the Philippines and complies with the Data Privacy Act of the Philippines.
